faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Find answers to common questions about orthopedic care and procedures
faq.askQuestionDescription: Don't see your question? Ask Dr. Eryanılmaz directly and get a personalized response.
faq.responseTime: Questions are reviewed and answered by Dr. Eryanılmaz. Responses are typically provided within 24-48 hours.
faq.urgentContact: For urgent medical questions or to schedule an appointment:

questions.kneeReplacementTime: How long does knee replacement surgery take?
questions.arthroscopicRecovery: What is the recovery time for arthroscopic surgery?
questions.pediatricTreatment: Do you treat pediatric orthopedic conditions?
questions.firstConsultation: What should I expect during my first consultation?
questions.surgeryPreparation: How do I prepare for orthopedic surgery?
questions.surgeryRisks: What are the risks of joint replacement surgery?
questions.implantDuration: How long do joint replacements last?

answers.kneeReplacementTime: Knee replacement surgery typically takes 1-2 hours, depending on the complexity of the case. The procedure involves removing damaged cartilage and bone, then positioning the new metal and plastic joint surfaces.
answers.arthroscopicRecovery: Recovery time for arthroscopic surgery varies depending on the procedure, but most patients can return to light activities within 1-2 weeks and full activities within 4-6 weeks. Physical therapy is crucial for optimal recovery.
answers.pediatricTreatment: Yes, Dr. Eryanılmaz specializes in pediatric orthopedics, including developmental hip dysplasia (DDH), clubfoot, and various childhood orthopedic conditions. Early intervention is often key to successful treatment.
answers.firstConsultation: During your first consultation, Dr. Eryanılmaz will review your medical history, perform a physical examination, and discuss your symptoms. You may need X-rays or other imaging studies to help with diagnosis and treatment planning.
answers.surgeryPreparation: Preparation includes following pre-operative instructions, arranging transportation, organizing help at home, and completing any required medical clearances. Dr. Eryanılmaz's team will provide detailed pre-operative guidelines.
answers.surgeryRisks: While joint replacement is generally very safe, potential risks include infection, blood clots, implant loosening, and nerve damage. Dr. Eryanılmaz will discuss all risks and benefits with you before surgery.
answers.implantDuration: Modern joint replacements typically last 15-20 years or more. The longevity depends on factors such as your age, activity level, weight, and the type of implant used.
answers.internationalPatients: Yes, Dr. Eryanılmaz treats patients from both Turkey and Azerbaijan. The practice can assist with coordination of care for international patients, including pre-operative consultations and post-operative follow-up.
